definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: Those who chose to be idle, certainly might.
sentences.chinese: 誰要是存心偷懶，當然也可以。

sentences.english: Did he pray for the men who were trying to destroy him?
sentences.chinese: 他有否爲到那些存心諂害他的人禱告呢？

sentences.english: He generally means well, but he is a little tactless .
sentences.chinese: 一般說他們的存心是好的，不過他對人有些生硬罷了。

sentences.english: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children
sentences.chinese: 只在你們中間存心溫柔，如同母親乳養自己的孩子。

sentences.english: It's wrong of you to get around the regulation.
sentences.chinese: 你存心規避規章制度是不對的。
存心忍耐的，勝過居心驕傲的。

sentences.english: They acted in bad faith, using the name of the group to gain their own selfish ends.
sentences.chinese: 他們做事存心不良，利用集體的名義圖謀私利。

sentences.english: Jonathan was punished for hurting his younger brother wittingly.
sentences.chinese: 強納生因爲存心傷害弟弟而受到懲罰。

sentences.english: Somebody has been cooking up a story out of spite and telling it to the old man .
sentences.chinese: 有人存心造謠，編了一個故事，跑去告訴老人。

sentences.english: It's true that Simba didn't intentionally kill him, but you know who did?
sentences.chinese: 辛巴是沒有存心殺死他，你知道誰想這麼幹？

sentences.english: 'Even giving advice is geared toward lowering the others' self-esteem.
sentences.chinese: 即使是給對方提建議也是存心打擊對方的自尊。

sentences.english: Those dishonest builders always try to cut corners.
sentences.chinese: 那些存心不良的建築商老想偷工減料。

sentences.english: It is a style which I have deliberately abandoned as too rhetorical.
sentences.chinese: 這種文體風格我因爲它過分藻飾華麗已經存心放棄了。

sentences.english: It seemed as if the lawyer was deliberately being as obnoxious as possible .
sentences.chinese: 那個律師給人的印象是存心要惹人討厭。

definition: to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
